game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class represents a player in the Connect4 game. It holds information about the player's name, piece color, and whether the player is a human or a computer.

    This class provides methods to set and retrieve the player's name, piece color, and type (human or computer). It is essential for managing player-specific data and interactions within the game.

    Since:
    2024-09-23

      • isComputer

        public boolean isComputer()
        Checks if the player is a computer.
        Returns:
        true if the player is a computer, false if the player is human

      • setComputer

        public void setComputer(boolean computer)
        Sets whether the player is a computer or a human.
        Parameters:
        computer - true to set the player as a computer, false for human

        Gets the player's piece color.
